wikipedia_page.main: Nicholas "Nick" James Atkin (18 September 1960 – 22 October 2009) was professor of modern European history at the University of Reading.

response: * Tallett, Frank,  and Nicholas Atkin. Religion, society, and politics in France since 1789 (1991)
*Nicholas Atkin – Professor of Modern European History, University of Reading; historical biographer and author

His band suffered many casualties, and some of his lieutenants, such as Ninco Nanco and Giuseppe "Sparviero" Schiavone, were captured and executed by firing squad, leaving Crocco to retire toward the Ofanto zone. After losing the last battle, he was forced to flee to the Papal States, hoping for help from Pius IX, whom he knew had previously supported the southern opposition.Nicholas Atkin, Frank Tallet, Priests, prelates and people: a history of European Catholicism since 1750, p.134
*Nicholas Atkin, Frank Tallet, Priests, prelates and people: a history of European Catholicism since 1750, I.B.Tauris, 2003.
* Themes in modern European history, 1890-1945. Routledge, 2009. (Edited with Nicholas Atkin)
* The Wiley-Blackwell dictionary of modern European history since 1789. Wiley-Blackwell, 2011. (Edited with Nicholas Atkin and Frank Tallett)
